intro: Primula peduncularis, commonly known as the clustered primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring a basal rosette of hairy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, white, or pink, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and delicate appearance, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
